Race.SpecificTitle: PW HRC Amend.Art.IV&V,Rec. -- CC - Art. IV & V, Rec
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Home Rule City Charter Amendment)
(New Orleans Recreation Development Commission)

Summary:  This proposition amends Article IV and Article V of the Home Rule Charter of the City of New Orleans relative to the Department of Recreation.  The amendments make substantive changes, including the following:  creating the New Orleans Recreation Development Commission; redefining the functions of the Department of Parks and Parkways; eliminating the Department of Recreation and transferring its duties and responsibilities to the New Orleans Recreation Development Commission; and providing for the composition, powers, duties, functions and administration of the Commission; these and other technical and substantive charter amendments proposed in this proposition are contained in appendices "A" and "B" to Ordinance No. 23998 M.C.S.
Race.FullText: Shall Chapter 10 of Article IV of the Home Rule Charter of the City of New Orleans relative to the Department of Recreation be deleted; shall Article IV, Chapter 17, Section 4-1701 relative to the Department of Parks and Parkways be amended by making the additions, deletions and modifications summarized hereinabove and as fully set forth in Appendix "A" to Ordinance No. 23998 M.C.S; and shall Article V, Chapter 10, Sections 5-1001 through 5-1003 relative to the New Orleans Recreation Development Commission be added by making the additions, deletions and modifications summarized hereinabove and as fully set forth in Appendix "B" to Ordinance No. 23998 M.C.S.?

Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Home Rule City Charter Amendment)
(Organization of the Sewerage and Water Board)

Summary:  Proposition amends Article V, Chapter 3, Section 5-301 of the Home Rule Charter of the City of New Orleans relative to the Organization of the Sewerage and Water Board.  The amendment makes a substantive change, as follows:  removes the requirement that the Board include both at large members of the Council and one district councilmember selected by the Council; require that one at large member of the Council and two other councilmembers, all selected by the Council, sit on the Board.
Race.FullText: Shall Article V, Chapter 3, Section 5-301 of the Home Rule Charter of the City of New Orleans relative to the Organization of the Sewerage and Water Board be amended by making the additions, deletions and modifications summarized hereinabove and as fully set forth in Appendix "A" to Ordinance No. 23996 M.C.S.?

Race.SpecificTitle: Subdist.No.1 FrenchQtr -- Parcel fee - CC - 4 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Subdistrict No. 1 of the French Quarter-Marigny Historic Area Management District Proposition

Summary:  4 year, annual parcel fee in Subdistrict No. 1 of the French Quarter-Marigny Historic Area Management District for the purpose of providing services to enhance public safety, security, and crime prevention in Subdistrict No. 1, and such services shall be supplemental to, and not in lieu of, personnel, police, and other services provided in Subdistrict No. 1 by the City of New Orleans and its agencies and departments, and all purposes incidental thereto.
Race.FullText: Shall Subdistrict No. 1 of the French Quarter-Marigny Historic Area Management District ("Subdistrict No. 1"), levy and collect an annual parcel fee in the amounts within the classifications set forth in SB 269 of the 2010 Louisiana Legislative Session, which amounts and classifications are available for inspection by the public at the office of Subdistrict No. 1 located at 100 Conti Street, New Orleans, Louisiana 70130, during regularly scheduled business hours, on each lot, subdivided portion of ground and/or individual tract located in Subdistrict No. 1, for a period of 4 years, beginning with the year 2011 and ending with the year 2014 (an estimated $900,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of said parcel fee for an entire year), for the purpose of providing services to enhance public safety, security, and crime prevention in Subdistrict No. 1, and such services shall be supplemental to, and not in lieu of, personnel, police, and other services provided in Subdistrict No. 1 by the City of New Orleans and its agencies and departments, and all purposes incidental thereto?
